page.title: 09Vintage Farm Machinery Show
page.content: In September each year the Southern County Historical Vehicle Trust hold an exhibition in Eridge Old Park. Vintage tractors and ploughs demonstrate how ploughing used to be done. Thrashing machines and binders can be seen in action showing the old techniques of harvesting the corn. For the nostalgic it is a reminder of the good old days and a chance for older farmers to reminisce on by gone methods of farming. For some the annual ploughing match is more of a challenge.Each October farmers from a 15 mile area around Crowborough come to Eridge to test their skill in ploughing a straight furrow.Much enjoy ment is had by all. Its an opportunity for a get together and a popular social gathering before the cold of winter sets in.
